contentTypes.name: Media Item
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Media Item" for an OTT media platform.  Fields required:  - item_id (short text, required, unique) - title (short text, required) - media_type (dropdown with values: audio, video, livestream) - source_type (dropdown with values: youtube, custom_url, contentful_upload) - media_urls (long text field allowing multiple URLs separated by commas) - uploaded_media (media asset field, optional) - youtube_playlist_id (short text, optional) - playlist (reference field to Play

contentTypes.name: Playlist
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Playlist" for grouping OTT videos or audios into collections or series.  Fields required:  - playlist_id (short text, required, unique) - title (short text, required) - description (long text, optional) - youtube_playlist_id (short text, optional) - episodes (multi reference field pointing to Media Item, optional) - authors (multi reference field pointing to Author, optional) - poster_image (media asset, optional) - is_active (boolean, default true)  This will suppo

validations.message: Only heading 1, heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, and inline entry nodes are allowed
Only bold, italic, underline, and code marks are allowed

contentTypes.name: Channel
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Channel" to manage live TV channels inside an OTT platform.  Fields required:  - channel_id (short text, required, unique) - channel_name (short text, required) - stream_urls (long text allowing multiple URLs separated by commas) - channel_logo (media asset, optional) - tags (short text list, optional) - is_active (boolean, default true)  Editors should be able to add YouTube Live or HLS URLs easily.

contentTypes.name: Section
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Section" to build custom homepage rows and featured carousels in an OTT app.  Fields required:  - section_id (short text, required, unique) - title (short text, required) - section_type (dropdown values: manual, auto) - items (multi reference field allowing selection of Media Item, Playlist or Channel) - layout_type (dropdown values: carousel, grid) - is_active (boolean, default true)  This CMS is used to manually curate home screen rows and promotional sections.

contentTypes.name: Schedule Rule
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Schedule Rule" for managing daily and calendar based content recommendations.  Fields required:  - rule_id (short text, required, unique) - rule_title (short text, required) - hijri_date (short text, example: 13-Rajab, optional) - weekdays (multi select dropdown: mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat, sun) - scheduled_items (multi reference to Media Item or Playlist) - is_active (boolean, default true)  This CMS will allow editors to show special Duas and content based on we

contentTypes.name: Advertisement
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Advertisement" for managing banner and video ads in an OTT app.  Fields required:  - ad_id (short text, required, unique) - ad_type (dropdown: banner, interstitial, overlay) - ad_image (media asset, required) - click_url (short text, optional) - placement (dropdown: home-top, home-middle, between-sections, player-pre, player-mid) - is_active (boolean, default true)  Editors must be able to place ads in different screen positions easily.

contentTypes.name: App Config
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "App Config" to store application configuration and versioning data.  Fields required:  - app_version (short text) - release_notes (long text) - is_active (boolean, default true)  This will help manage application releases and change tracking.

Only bold, italic, underline, and code marks are allowed

contentTypes.name: Author
contentTypes.description: Create a content type called "Author" for an Islamic OTT CMS.  Fields required: - author_id (short text, required, unique value) - name (short text, required) - biography (long text, optional) - profile_photo (media asset, optional) - is_active (boolean, default true)  Use clean labels suitable for non technical editors.

content.value: Hajj Mahdi Samavati is a distinguished Iranian reciter and spiritual artist renowned for his soulful renditions of Islamic supplications, prayers, and pilgrimages. Inheriting the art of devotional recitation across three generations, he has dedicated his life to preserving and reviving the authentic tradition of supplication within the Islamic world.

Through his unique voice and heartfelt delivery, Hajj Mahdi Samavati has inspired countless listeners to deepen their spiritual connection with the Divine. His extensive body of work includes high-quality recordings of revered supplications such as Dua Kumayl, Dua Tawassul, Dua Arafah, and Dua Abu Hamzah Thumali, as well as the sacred pilgrimages of Ashura, Jamiah Kabeerah, and Al-Yaseen.

As the official representative of the Bayt al-Hussain (AS) society, he continues to lead weekly ceremonies and special religious gatherings, offering a profound spiritual experience that blends devotion, art, and tradition. His mission remains to guide hearts toward peace, reflection, and closeness to the Creator through the timeless beauty of prayer.

Abather Al Halawaji (Arabic:  ) is a renowned and deeply respected reciter (maddah/munshid) of Islamic supplications, prayers, and elegies within the global Shia Muslim community. Hailing from Bahrain, he has become a distinctive voice recognized for his deeply moving, melodious, and devotional style that resonates with listeners seeking spiritual connection.

Al Halawaji dedicated his career to the sacred art of reciting duas (supplications), munajats (whispered prayers), and latmiyas (elegies commemorating religious figures, particularly those related to the tragedy of Karbala).

-

His recitations are characterized by a clear, emotive vocal delivery that emphasizes contemplation and humility. He is particularly celebrated for the emotional weight and spiritual energy he brings to classic Shi'a devotional texts.

He has produced definitive audio recordings of essential Shi'a prayers, including the lengthy and profound Dua Kumail, Ziyarat Ashura, Dua Iftitah, and Dua Tawassul. These recordings serve as a primary spiritual resource for millions worldwide.

While rooted in Middle Eastern religious traditions, Al Halawaji has achieved a global audience. His work transcends geographical and linguistic barriers, making his recitations accessible to diverse communities across Europe, North America, Africa, and Asia, often accompanied by translations in English, Urdu, and other languages.

A prominent figure in the digital Islamic media landscape, his content is widely distributed across all major streaming platforms, including YouTube, ensuring his voice is readily available for daily worship and remembrance.
Abather Al Halawaji remains a significant contemporary religious personality whose contributions continue to aid believers in their spiritual journeys
